A function to compute fold power increase (FPI)

Source: R/FPI.R
getFPI.GRanges.Rd

This function takes a GRanges and a k-mer of interest, along with a given period. It calculates the FPI, as introduced by Pich et al., Cell 2018.

# S3 method for GRanges
getFPI(x, genome, ...)

Arguments

x

GRanges, GRanges of interest
genome

Genome ID or BSgenome
...

Additional arguments

Value

Several metrics including FPI, observed PSD, etc...

Details

The FPI is calculated as the ratio of the observed k-mer PSD at the chosen perdiod subtracted by the median k-mer PSD in shuffled sequences, divided by the median k-mer PSD in shuffled sequences. The number of shufflings is specified by the n_shuffling argument.

Examples

data(ce11_TSSs)
fpi <- getFPI(
    ce11_TSSs[['Ubiq.']][1:10],
    genome = 'ce11',
    motif = 'TT',
    cores_shuffling = 1
)
#> - Calculating observed PSD
#> - Mapping k-mers.
#> - 76459 pairwise distances measured.
#> - Calculating pairwise distance distribution.
#> - Normalizing histogram vector.
#> - Applying Fast Fourier Transform to the vector of distances.
#> >> Measured PSD @ 10bp is: 9.02565541651108e-07
#> - Shuffling 1/10
#> - Shuffling 2/10
#> - Shuffling 3/10
#> - Shuffling 4/10
#> - Shuffling 5/10
#> - Shuffling 6/10
#> - Shuffling 7/10
#> - Shuffling 8/10
#> - Shuffling 9/10
#> - Shuffling 10/10
#> >> Calculated FPI @ 10bp is: 22.9749300890685
fpi$FPI
#> [1] 22.97493
fpi$observed_PSD
#> [1] 9.025655e-07
fpi$shuffled_PSD
#>  [1] 6.375603e-08 4.841936e-08 5.823182e-09 2.687309e-08 2.077292e-07
#>  [6] 7.405588e-08 7.922293e-09 8.013376e-09 2.224144e-08 7.169595e-08
p1 <- plotFPI(fpi)
fpi <- getFPI(
    ce11_TSSs[['Muscle']][1:10],
    genome = 'ce11',
    motif = 'TT',
    cores_shuffling = 1
)
#> - Calculating observed PSD
#> - Mapping k-mers.
#> - 82811 pairwise distances measured.
#> - Calculating pairwise distance distribution.
#> - Normalizing histogram vector.
#> - Applying Fast Fourier Transform to the vector of distances.
#> >> Measured PSD @ 10bp is: 3.17668567134466e-08
#> - Shuffling 1/10
#> - Shuffling 2/10
#> - Shuffling 3/10
#> - Shuffling 4/10
#> - Shuffling 5/10
#> - Shuffling 6/10
#> - Shuffling 7/10
#> - Shuffling 8/10
#> - Shuffling 9/10
#> - Shuffling 10/10
#> >> Calculated FPI @ 10bp is: 0.626411569516806
fpi$FPI
#> [1] 0.6264116
fpi$observed_PSD
#> [1] 3.176686e-08
fpi$shuffled_PSD
#>  [1] 5.661027e-08 4.791134e-09 8.936022e-08 1.220300e-08 4.487382e-08
#>  [6] 2.686074e-08 9.128840e-10 1.223240e-09 2.386138e-09 4.882938e-08
p2 <- plotFPI(fpi)
cowplot::plot_grid(p1, p2)
#> `geom_smooth()` using formula 'y ~ x'
